intro: Tarenna papyracea, commonly known as the paperleaf tarenna, is a small evergreen shrub native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its thin, papery leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. Tarenna papyracea typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments. Its flowers are small and white, often clustered in dense inflorescences.
